en.ugokupad-desc: UGOKU Pad is an app that allows you to easily control microcontrollers like ESP32 from your smartphone via Bluetooth. You can create your own control panel by combining various widgets like joysticks, sliders, and buttons. It can be used for various purposes such as motor control and monitoring sensor data.
en.features-desc: On the control panel (Console), you can place input widgets like toggle switches and joysticks, or monitor widgets like Value Monitor and Line Chart in any position and size. Each widget can be assigned an arbitrary channel number.
en.start-guide-desc: By installing the UGOKU Pad Arduino library, you can easily communicate with UGOKU Pad using ESP32-equipped boards.
en.sample-sketch-title: Sample Sketch: Controlling a Servo Motor / Displaying ADC Readings
en.esp32-wire-desc: Wiring example for connecting ESP32 and UGOKU Pad.
en.board-install-desc: Install Arduino ESP32 Boards and esp32 in BOARD MANAGER
en.board-select-desc: Search for and select ESP32 Dev Module in Select Other Board and Port
en.sketch-upload-desc: Upload the following sample sketch to ESP32.
en.app-step-1: Tap the menu button on the top left
en.app-step-4: Tap Select, then tap Scan Device
en.app-step-7: Return to the operation screen using the back button
en.ble-comm-desc: The app supports standard BLE on Android/iOS using the flutter_blue_plus library for Flutter. Each packet is fixed at 19 bytes. Efficiency and low latency are achieved by using 9 pairs of (Channel, Value) and a 1-byte checksum.
en.periodic-send-desc: The periodicSend() function called every 50ms performs the following:
en.periodic-step-1: Aggregate data for up to 9 channels into one packet
en.periodic-step-2: If less than 9 channels, pad with dummy data (0) to 19 bytes
en.periodic-step-3: Calculate XOR checksum of the first 18 bytes and append it
en.periodic-step-4: BLE transmission via Write Without Response
en.periodic-step-5: Data exceeding 9 channels is automatically split into multiple packets
